qas.question: What was the name of the railroad that began construction in 1836?
The Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad was going to connect Wilmington to what city?
What direction did the North carolina railroad extend?
What stretch of the railroad was vital to the confederates in the civil war?

context: On October 25, 1836, construction began on the <a0_0>Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad<a0_0/> to connect the port city of Wilmington with the state capital of <a1_0>Raleigh<a1_0/>. In 1849 the <a2_0>North Carolina Railroad<a2_0/> was created by act of the legislature to extend that railroad <a3_0>west<a3_0/> to Greensboro, High Point, and Charlotte. During the Civil War, the <a4_0>Wilmington-to-Raleigh stretch<a4_0/> of the railroad would be vital to the Confederate war effort; supplies shipped into Wilmington would be moved by rail through Raleigh to the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia.
